column5: You know those pull and release looped ties when collapsing your two or three piece rods,keeps them tight together. After looking at BPS,Sail,and a few stores in the city,also a couple of the local shops,ended up finding them at Fish Ontario on the 400. Two in a pack for $5.00. I see as well as myself people using elastic bands,twist ties etc.Just thought I'd pass it on to all. davey.
love those ties...  local shop near me caries them too
Rack and Reel in Barrie has something very similar. Very handy when camping.
PICS? I use hair braid thingymabobs.
I bought some sewing elastics and some of those push in buttons for laces and I make my own. I spent $5.00 of material at Walmart and made myself 15 of them.
Tried rack and reel a while back,didn't have them than.
Wally you need to market them.A buck or two to be made maybe?
They had them in a basket up on the front desk for a while in the spring.  Must have ran out, and not re-stocked..
Tightline in Pickering has had them for years.  I end up using them just about everywhere.
Angling Outfitters near Woodstock also carries them.
I use my Daughter's hair elastics with the beads on them..      Randy
